SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

mcm.theater
Class Arguments

java.lang.Object
  mcm.theater.Arguments

public class Arguments
extends java.lang.Object

Arguments bundle runtime arguments relevant to Actors and Stage. An Arguments instance contains a mapping of Strings to Values, that is of argumentnames to argument values. Argument names are strings that are case insensitive. For example "VIS" and "vis" are considered to be the same. Values are typed. There are Boolean, Integer, Double, Color, and String arguments. Upon instanciation Arguments initiate their argument map to the following default name, value mapping:

  • ACTORVISIBLE=> true
  • ACTORDEBUG => false
  • SHAPEFILLED => true
  • TRAILWIDTH => 1
  • STEPSIZE => 5
  • WINCOLOR => Color.BLACK;
  • LEAVE => false
  • HEIGHT => 500
  • WIDTH => 809 (the golden ratio)
  • DUMPNAME => null
  • DUMPDELAY => 100
  • FRAMEDELAY => 45
  • TRACEINC => 0
  • TRACETHREADS => false
  • TRACETIME => false

Author:
Monika Mevenkamp

DUMPDELAY

public static final java.lang.String DUMPDELAY
Ease-of-use constant for getting and setting the delay in stage clock ticks between dumping images. The setting is effective only iff DUMPNAME is non empty.

See Also:
StageDump, Constant Field Values

DUMPNAME

public static final java.lang.String DUMPNAME
Ease-of-use constant for getting and setting the name of the image dump file. A StageDump actor is started if DUMPNAME is set to filename.

See Also:
StageDump, Constant Field Values

Constructor Detail

Arguments

public Arguments(javax.swing.JApplet applet)
Creates instance reading argument values from Applet. Uses default argument values where the given applet has no parameter setting.

Parameters:
applet - applet whose parameters are used fro argument values

Arguments

public Arguments(java.lang.String cmdLine)
Creates instance reading argument values from command line. Uses default argument values where command line does not contain a setting.

Parameters:
cmdLine - command line given as -

getColor

public java.awt.Color getColor(java.lang.String argName)
Get the Value for the given parameter as a Color value. Values are expected to be in #rrggbb format.

Parameters:
argName - name of the parameter whose value is retrieved
Returns:
the parameter value or Color.WHITE if parameter does not exist or is not a Color value.

setDoubleVal

public void setDoubleVal(java.lang.String prop,
                         java.lang.String value,
                         double minVal)
Set the value of the given parameter to the Double value corresponding to the given value string. If the given value does not represent a Double value greater or equal the given minimum value an error message is printed and no action is taken.

Parameters:
prop - name of the parameter whose value is set
value - string representing the parameter's new Double value
minVal - the given value is required to be greater or equal to this value

setIntVal

public void setIntVal(java.lang.String prop,
                      java.lang.String value,
                      int minVal)
Set the value of the given parameter to the int value corresponding to the given value string. If the given value does not represent an int value greater or equal the given minimum value an error message is printed and no action is taken.

Parameters:
prop - name of the parameter whose value is set
value - string representing the parameter's new int value
minVal - the given value is required to be greater or equal to this value

setString

public void setString(java.lang.String prop,
                      java.lang.String value)
Set the value of the given parameter to the given value string. No action is taken if value equals null

Parameters:
prop - name of the parameter whose value is set
value - string representing the parameter's new value
